dungeons

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeons.Square

  • public class Square
extends Object
    A class for the creation of objects of Squares.
    Author:
    Christof Vermeersch & Edward Van Sieleghem
    Invariants:
  • The square can maximum have 6 boundaries.
        obstacleMap.size() <= 6
  • The obstacles must be valid.
        hasProperObstacles() ==  true
  • The neighbors must be valid.
        hasProperNeighbors() == true
  • The temperature must be the same as the other squares of its group. Also the temperature must be between valid boundaries.
        hasProperTemperature() == true

    • Constructor Detail

      • Square

        public Square()
        A standard constructor. This constructor doesn't have any arguments. The temperature will be set to a default value.
        Postconditions:
      • The temperature is set to a default value.
            new.getTemperature() == DEFAULT_TEMPERATURE
      • The newly created square is surrounded by walls.
            for each direction in Direction.values():
             new.hasWall(direction) == true

      • Square

        public Square(int temp)
        A temperature constructor. This constructor has a temperature as argument.
        Parameters:
        temp - The given temperature.
        Postconditions:
      • The temperature is set to the given value.
            new.getTemperature() == temp
      • The newly created square is surrounded by walls.
            for each direction in Direction.values():
             new.hasWall(direction) == true

    • Method Detail

      • isTerminated

        @Basic
public boolean isTerminated()
        Method to check if the square is terminated.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminator
        Postconditions:
      • The square is set terminated.
            new.isTerminated() == true
      • The square is surrounded by walls.
            for each direction in Direction.values(): new.hasWall(direction) == true
      • At the place where the square had neighbors, the neighbors will also have walls.
            for each direction in Direction.values():
             if(old.getNeighborAt(direction != null)
             then (new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction))).hasWall(direction) == true
      • The square doesn't have any neighbors left.
            new.getNeighbors().isEmpty() == true

      • isValidTemperature

        public static boolean isValidTemperature(int temp)
        Checker that tells if the given temperature is valid as start temperature for an isolated square.
        Parameters:
        temp - The temperature to test.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the temperature is between the two boundary temperatures.
            return == (temp < this.getMaxTemperature() && temp < this.getMinTemperature())

      • hasProperTemperature

        public boolean hasProperTemperature()
        Checker that tells if the current temperature is valid.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the temperature is between the two boundary temperatures and the temperature is the same as in the other squares of the group containing this square.
            return == (isValidTemperature(this.getTemperature())
             && (this.getTemperature() == this.calculateUpdateTemperature())

      • calculateTemperatureDamage

        public int calculateTemperatureDamage()
        A method to calculate the damage due too temperature.
        Returns:
        If the temperature is too hot, there will be a certain points damage for each specified step of degrees above a certain temperature.
            If(this.getTemperature() > this.getHeatDamageAbove())
             then return == (((this.getTemperature()-this.getHeatDamageAbove)/this.getHeatDamageStep)*this.getUnitHeatDamage()
        Returns:
        If the temperature is too cold, there will be 1 point damage for each 10° below -5°.
            If(this.getTemperature() < -5)
             then return == (abs(this.getTemperature())-5)/10
        Returns:
        If the temperature is between the boundaries there will be no damage.
            If(this.getTemperature() > this.getHeatDamageAbove() && this.getTemperature() < -5)
             then return == 0

      • calculateUpdateTemperature

        public int calculateUpdateTemperature()
        Method to calculate the temperature of a group without changing it.
        Returns:
        The temperature of the whole group will be the average of all the squares in the group.
            for each square in computeGroup():
             return == (for each square in computeGroup():
              sum = sum + old.square.getTemperature)/calculateGroup().size()

      • setMaxTemperature

        public static void setMaxTemperature(int temp)
        Method to set the maximum temperature.
        Parameters:
        temp - The specified maximum temperature.
        Postcondition:
        The current maximum temperature is set to the given one.
            new.getMaxTemperature() == temp

        Method to set the minimum temperature.
        Parameters:
        temp - The specified minimum temperature.
        Postcondition:
        The current minimum temperature is set to the given one.
            new.getMinTemperature() == temp

      • setUnitHeatDamage

        public static void setUnitHeatDamage(int unit)
        Method to set new unit for heat damage.
        Parameters:
        unit - The new unit for heat damage.
        Postcondition:
        The unit will be update too the new one.
            new.getUnitHeatDamage() == unit

      • setHeatDamageStep

        public static void setHeatDamageStep(int step)
        Method to set new step for heat damage.
        Parameters:
        step - The new step for heat damage.
        Postcondition:
        The step will be update too the new one.
            new.getHeatDamageStep() == step

      • setHeatDamageAbove

        public static void setHeatDamageAbove(int limit)
        Method to set new limit for heat damage.
        Parameters:
        limit - The new limit for heat damage.
        Postcondition:
        The limit will be update too the new one.
            new.getHeatDamageAbove() == limit

      • updateTemperature

        public void updateTemperature()
        Method to set the temperature of a group.
        Postcondition:
        The temperature of the whole group will be set to the average of all the squares in the group.
            for each square in this.computeGroup():
             square.getTemperature() == this.calculateUpdateTemperature()

public Collection<dungeons.obstacle.Obstacle> getObstacles()
        Inspector to retrieve all the obstacles of a square.

      • getNbOfObstacles

        public int getNbOfObstacles()
        Inspector to retrieve number of obstacles.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of obstacles for this Square.
            return == obstaclesMap.size()

      • getObstacleAt

        public dungeons.obstacle.Obstacle getObstacleAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Inspector to retrieve obstacle in given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The selected direction.
        Returns:
        The obstacle in the given direction.
            return == obstaclesMap.get(dir)

      • hasDoor

        public boolean hasDoor(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Inspector to check if a square has a door in a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction you want to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square has a door in that direction.
            return == (this.getObstacleAt(dir) instanceof Door)

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Inspector to check if a door in a certain direction is open.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which you want to check the door.
        Returns:
        If there is a door in that direction, returns true if the door is open.
            if(this.hasDoor(dir))
             then return == ((Door)this.getObstacleAt(dir)).isOpen()
        Returns:
        If there is no door in that direction, returns false.
            if(!this.hasDoor(dir))
             then return == false

      • hasWall

        public boolean hasWall(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Inspector to check if a square has a wall in a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction you want to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square has a wall in that direction.
            return == (getObstacleAt(dir) instanceof Wall)

      • hasSameAdjecantObstacleAt

        public boolean hasSameAdjecantObstacleAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to check if a square and its neighbor have the same obstacle in the given direction, seen from this square.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the obstacle is the same for this and his neighbor in a given direction. This is also important for the moveability.
            if(this.hasWall(dir))
             then return == this.getNeighborAt(dir).hasWall(dir.oppositeDirection())
            if(this.hasDoor(dir))
             then return == this.getNeighborAt(dir).hasDoor(dir.oppositeDirection())
             && (this.isOpen(dir) == this.getNeighborAt(dir).isOpen(dir.oppositeDirection())
            if(!this.hasDoor(dir) && !this.hasWall(dir))
             then return == !this.getNeighborAt(dir).hasDoor(dir.oppositeDirection())
             && !this.getNeighborAt(dir)hasWall(dir.oppositeDirection())

      • hasProperObstacles

        public boolean hasProperObstacles()
        Checker that controls if the obstacles that are set now are possible for this square.
        Returns:
        Returns true if all the obstacles are valid for this square and if there is a neighbor, the neighbor has the same obstacle with the same moveability.
            for some direction in Direction.values():
              if(!this.canHaveAsObstacle(direction, this.getObstacleAt(direction))
             || !this.hasSameAdjecantObstacleAt(direction)
             || (if(this.hasDoorAt(direction))
             then this.getObstacleAt(direction).isOpen() == this.getNeighborAt(direction).getObstacleAt(direction.oppositeDirection()).isOpen))
             then return == false

      • canHaveAsObstacleAt

        public boolean canHaveAsObstacleAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir,
                          dungeons.obstacle.Obstacle obstacle)
        Checker that checks if given obstacle is possible in certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which you want to check.
        obstacle - The obstacle you want to check.
        Returns:
        The method will return the return of canBeAnObstacleAt of the specific obstacle.
            return == obstacle.canBeAnObstacleAt(this, dir)

      • buildWallAt

        public void buildWallAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to build walls at given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which you want to add a wall.
        Postconditions:
      • If it is possible to set a wall, the wall will be set at the given direction.
            if(canHaveAsObstacle(dir, new Wall())
             then new.hasWall(dir) == true
      • If the square has a neighbor at the given direction and the building of a wall is possible, then a wall will also be set in the adjecant square at opposite direction.
            If(getNeighbor(dir) != null && canHaveAsObstacle(dir, new Wall())
             then getNeighborAt(dir).hasWallAt(dir.oppositeDirection())

      • buildDoorAt

        public void buildDoorAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to build doors at given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which you want to add a wall.
        Postconditions:
      • If it is possible to set a door, the door will be set at the given direction. The door will be set open.
            if(canHaveAsObstacle(dir, new Door())
             then new.hasDoor(dir) == true && new.isOpen(dir)
      • If the square has a neighbor at the given direction and the building of a door is possible, then a door will also be set in the adjecant square at opposite direction. The door will also be set open.
            If(getNeighbor(dir) != null && canHaveAsObstacle(dir, new Door())
             then getNeighborAt(dir).hasWallAt(dir.oppositeDirection() && getNeighborAt(dir).isOpen(dir.oppositeDirection())
      • If the door is build (and as a consequence set open) the temperature of the newly formed group will be updated.
            for each square in this.calculateGroup():
             square.getTemperature() == square.calculateUpdateTemperature()

      • setOpen

        public void setOpen(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to open a door at given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which you want to open the door.
        Postcondition:
        If there is a door in that direction, the method opens the door. The temperature will also be recalculated for the newly formed group
            if(this.hasDoor(dir))
             then new.isOpen() == true
             && new.getTemperature() == this.calculateUpdateTemperature()
        Returns:
        If there is no door in that direction, the method does nothing.
            if(!this.hasDoor(dir))
             then new.isOpen() == false

      • destroyObstacle

        public void destroyObstacle(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to destroy an obstacle at a given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The given direction.
        Postconditions:
      • If the obstacle can be destroyed, then this method will remove an obstacle in a given direction from the list with obstacles.
            if(this.canHaveAsObstacleAt(dir, null))
             then new.getObstacleAt(dir) == null
      • If the obstacle can be destroyed, and the square has a neighbor in that direction, then the obstacle of the neighbor at opposite direction will also be destroyed.
            if(this.canHaveAsObstacleat(dir, null) && this.getNeighborAt(dir) != null)
             then (new.getNeighborAt(dir)).getObstacleAt(dir.oppositeDirection()) == null
      • After the obstacle has been destroyed, the temperature will be set to the one of the new group that has been formed.
            new.getTemperature() == new.calculateUpdateTemperature()

      • destroyWallAt

        public void destroyWallAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to destroy a wall between two squares.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which the wall must be destroyed seen from this square.
        Effect:
        The wall will be destroyed if there is one and it could be destroyed. Also the temperature will be updated.
            destroyObstacle(dir)

      • destroyDoorAt

        public void destroyDoorAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to destroy a door between two squares.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which the door must be destroyed seen from this square.
        Effect:
        The door will be destroyed if there is one and it could be destroyed. Also the temperature will be updated.
            destroyObstacle(dir)

      • fixObstacles

        public void fixObstacles()
        When the obstacles aren't proper then this method will fix them. The obstacles will be set the same as those of the neighbor. Also the moveability of an obstacle will be set the same.
        Postconditions:
      • The method will set walls in every direction where there is no neighbor.
            for each dir in Direction.values():
             if(this.getNeighborAt(dir) == null)
             then new.hasWallAt(dir)
      • The method will set walls in every direction where the neighbor has walls.
            for each dir in Direction.values():
             if(this.getNeighborAt(dir).hasWallAt(dir.oppositeDirection()))
             then new.hasWallAt(dir) == true
      • The method will set doors in every direction where the neighbor has doors and the doors will have the same moveability
            for each dir in Direction.values():
             if(this.getNeighborAt(dir).hasDoorAt(dir.oppositeDirection())
             then new.hasDoorAt(dir) == true && (new.canMove(dir) == new.getNeighborAt(dir).canMove(dir.oppositeDirection()))
      • The method will destroy doors and walls in every direction where the neighbor hasn't any obstacles.
            for each dir in Direction.values():
             if(this.getNeighborAt(dir).getObstacleAt(dir.oppositeDirection() == null)
             then new.getObstacleAt(dir) == null

      • getNeighbors

        @Basic
public Collection<Square> getNeighbors()
        Inspector to retrieve all the neighbors of a square.

      • getNbOfNeighbors

        public int getNbOfNeighbors()
        Inspector to receive the number of neighbors.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of squares connected to this one.
            return == NeighborsMap.size()

      • getNeighborAt

        public Square getNeighborAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Inspector to retrieve neighbors in given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The selected direction.
        Returns:
        The neighbor in the given direction.
            return == NeighborsMap.get(dir)

      • getDirectionOfNeighbor

        public dungeons.util.Direction getDirectionOfNeighbor(Square neighbor)
        Inspector to retrieve the direction of a given neighbor.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - The neighbor to check.
        Returns:
        If the neighbor is a neighbor of this square then return its direction.
            if(this.hasAsNeighborAt(dir, neighbor)
             then result == dir
        Returns:
        If the neighbor isn't a neighbor of this square then return null as direction.
            if(this.hasAsNeigbor(neighbor) == false)
             then result == null

      • hasNeighborAt

        public boolean hasNeighborAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Checker to control if this square has a neighbor in a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square has a neighbor in the given direction.
            result == (this.getNeighborAt(dir) != null)

      • hasAsNeighbor

        public boolean hasAsNeighbor(Square square)
        Checker to control if this square has a given square as neighbor.
        Parameters:
        square - The square that could be connected to this one.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the square is connected to this one.
            result == (for some Neighbor in getNeighbors(): Neighbor == square)

      • hasAsNeighborAt

        public boolean hasAsNeighborAt(dungeons.util.Direction dir,
                      Square square)
        Check whether a neighbor is connected to a given square in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to look in.
        square - The square to check.
        Returns:
        True if the neighbor exists in the specific direction.
            result == (getNeighborAt(dir) == square)

      • hasProperNeighbors

        public boolean hasProperNeighbors()
        Check whether this square has proper neighbors.
        Returns:
        True if for each neighbor of this square in a specific direction, that neighbor is legal and has also this square as its neighbor in the inverse of that direction.
            result == (for each square in this.getObstacles():
             (canHaveAsNeighbor(square)) && (square.getNeighborAt(this.getDirectionOfNeighbor(square).oppositeDirection()) == this)

      • canHaveAsNeighbor

        public boolean canHaveAsNeighbor(Square square)
        Check whether the given square is valid as a neighbor for this square.
        Parameters:
        square - The square to check.
        Returns:
        If this square is terminated, then true if the given square is null.
            if(isTerminated())
             then ( result == ( square == null ) )
        Returns:
        Else if the given square is not null, true if the given square is not terminated.
            if(!isTerminated() && square != null ))
             then ( result == !square.isTerminated() )
        Returns:
        Else always true
            (!isTerminated() && square == null )
             then ( result == true )
        Note:
        If a neighbor is accepted by this method, it is automatically accepted in all directions. Method 'canHaveAsNeighborAt(Direction dir, Square square)' is not needed.

      • removeNeighbor

        public void removeNeighbor(dungeons.util.Direction direction)
        Remove the neighbor of this square in the given direction, if it can be removed.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of the square to remove as neighbor.
        Postconditions:
      • If the neighbor can be removed, this square does not have a neighbor anymore. Also the respective neighbor doesn't have this square as neighbor anymore.
            if(this.canHaveAsNeighbor(null) && (this.getNeighborAt(direction).canHaveAsNeighbor(null))
             then (new.getNeighborAt(direction) == null) && ((new.this).getNeighborAt(direction)).getNeighborAt(direction.oppositeDirection() == null )
      • Besides the removal of the neighbors there will also be set a wall at the direction where the connection of neighbors has been broken, so that the invariants will be respected.
            if(new.getNeighborAt(direction) == null) && ((new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction))).getNeighborAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == null )
             then (new.hasWallAt(direction) == true) && ((new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction))).hasWallAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == true)

      • registerNeighbor

        public void registerNeighbor(Square square,
                    dungeons.util.Direction direction)
        Register the given square as a neighbor of this square in the given direction. Also set the temperature according to the newly created group. The obstacles will be changed towards the obstacle of the neighbor. If this square already had a neighbor at that direction, the old neighbor will be removed.
        Parameters:
        square - The square to register as a neighbor
        direction - The direction of the given square relative to this square.
        Postconditions:
      • If the new neighbor is a legal neighbor, this square has the given square as its neighbor in the given direction. Also the given square has this square as its neighbor in the inverse of the given direction.
            if(this.canHaveAsNeighbor(square) && square.canHaveAsNeighbor(this))
             then (new.getNeighborAt(direction) == square && (new.square).getNeighborAt(Direction.oppositeDirection()) == this )
      • If this square already had a neighbor, then the old neighbor of this square will no longer have this square as its neighbor. At the place of its old connection with this square, the neighbor now has a wall.
            (new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction)).getNeighborAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == null
            (new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction)).hasWallAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == true
      • If the new neighbor had a neighbor at the opposite direction, then the old neighbor of this neighbor will no longer have this neighbor as its neighbor. At the place of its old connection with this neighbor, the neighbor now has a wall.
            (new.(old.(square.getNeighborAt(direction))).getNeighborAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == null
            (new.(old.(square.getNeighborAt(direction)).hasWallAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == true
      • The obstacles will be changed towards the obstacle of the neighbor.
            new.hasSameAdjecantObstacleAt(direction) == true
             && old.(new.getNeighbourAt(direction).getObstacleAt(direction.oppositeDirection()))
             == new.(new.getNeighbourAt(direction).getObstacleAt(direction.oppositeDirection()))
      • The temperature will be set according to the newly created group.
            for each square in this.computeGroup():
             new.square.getTemperature() == new.calculateUpdateTemperature()

      • copyNeighbors

        public void copyNeighbors(Square square)
        Method to copy all the neighbors from a given square to this one. The obstacles will be changed too the ones of the new squares you copy. The temperature must be changed according to the possible new group this square is now part of. Because you copy, the old (here called other) square will now be isolated.
        Parameters:
        square - The other square from which you want to copy.
        Postconditions:
      • If the given square is not null, all the neighbors will be copied to this one. The directions will be the same.
            if(square != null)
             then (for each direction in Direction.values():
             new.getNeighborAt(direction) == other.getNeighborAt(direction)
      • If the given square is not null (so that the neighbors will be copied), then the old neighbors of this square will no longer have this square as their neighbor. At the place of their old connection they will now have a wall.
            for each direction in Direction.values:
             (new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction)).getNeighborAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == null
             (new.(old.getNeighborAt(direction)).hasWallAt(direction.oppositeDirection()) == true
      • The other square will now be isolated.
            (new.other).getNbOfNeighbors() == 0
            for each direction in Direction.values():
             (new.other).hasWallAt(direction) == true
      • The obstacles will be changed too the ones of the new neighbors.
            for each direction in Direction.values():
             new.hasSameAdjecantObstacleAt(direction) == true
             && old.(new.getNeighbourAt(direction).getObstacleAt(direction.oppositeDirection()))
             == new.(new.getNeighbourAt(direction).getObstacleAt(direction.oppositeDirection()))
      • The temperature will be changed to the new group temperature.
            for each square in calculateGroup():
             square.getTemperature() == calculateUpdateTemperature()

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method that checks if you can move in a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to move in.
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is neighbor in that direction and there is no wall between them or the door is open. With other words, you can move in that direction.
            result == ((this.getNeighborAt(dir) != null) && (!this.hasWallAt(dir)) && (if(this.hasDoorAt(dir)) then getObstacleAt(dir).isOpen())

      • computeGroup

        @Raw
public ArrayList<Square> computeGroup()
        Method to compute a group of moveable squares.
        Returns:
        Creates a group of moveable squares. The list will contain adjecant squares that are moveable.
            for each dir in Direction.values():
             if(this.canMove(dir)
             then if(!result.contains(this.getNeighborAt(dir)))
             then result.add(this.getNeighborAt(dir)) && result.addAll(this.getNeighborAt(dir).computeGroup())
        Note:
        This method is annotated raw because the method can be used even when the temperature isn't updated yet.

      • mergeWith

        @Raw
public void mergeWith(dungeons.util.Direction dir)
        Method to merge a group of squares with another group of squares.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction of the other group.
        Postcondition:
        The temperature of each square in this and the other group will be the average of the squares in the two groups, taken in account the size of the two groups. We can also see this now as one group.
            for each square in calculateGroup():
             square.getTemperature() == square.calculateUpdateTemperature()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - [MUST] The direction is not valid if there doesn't exist a neighbor at the given direction.
            getNeighborAt(dir) == null
        Note:
        This method is annotated raw because the method can be used when the temperature isn't updated yet.
